definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: The UK hasn't had a gold standard for the past three generations.
sentences.chinese: 英国在过去的三代里一直没有金本位制。

sentences.english: So   England became on the gold standard.
sentences.chinese: 于是，英国成为了一个金本位制度的国家。

sentences.english: It examines how the decision to quit gold or to cleave to it affected trade policies.
sentences.chinese: 论文分析了放弃或坚持金本位是如何影响贸易政策的。

sentences.english: Thus, the gold standard resulted in a system of fixed exchange rates among participating nations.
sentences.chinese: 因此，金本位制导致各参与国之间形成固定汇率制。

sentences.english: It is held that this can only suffocate economies.
sentences.chinese: 因此金本位只会让经济窒息。

sentences.english: We have seen that on a gold standard, money, which is gold, cannot disappear.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道在金本位下，货币就是黄金，它不会消失。

sentences.english: On a pure gold standard without the central bank, money is gold.
sentences.chinese: 在没有中央银行的完全的金本位体系中，钱就是黄金。

sentences.english: Under a gold standard, paper notes are convertible into pre-set, fixed quantities of gold.
sentences.chinese: 在金本位制中，纸币可兑换既定的一定数量的黄金。

sentences.english: On a gold standard this cannot take place.
sentences.chinese: 如果基于金本位，这些就不会发生。

sentences.english: America went off the gold standard after the Great Depression.
sentences.chinese: 大萧条后，美国停止使用金本位制。

sentences.english: Most of the time, this was accomplished with a gold standard system.
sentences.chinese: 多数时候，这一做法凭借金本位制度得以实现。

definition: local currency/our own currency/abbr. to 本幣|本币
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
currency issued by Nationalist Government in 1948

pinyin: jin1 hui4 dui4 ben3 wei4 zhi4

definition: Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
local currency/our own currency/abbr. for 本位貨幣|本位货币
